items.title: Shooting at Rhode Island ice rink leaves at least two people dead
items.standfirst: Police confirm suspect is one of dead in incident at boys’ hockey game that injured four in PawtucketAt least three people are dead and three more hospitalized in critical condition in a mass shooting at an indoor ice rink in Pawtucket, Rhode Island, during a high school hockey match on Monday afternoon, the police said.The Pawtucket police chief, Tina Goncalves, told reporters at a news conference that the suspect is one of the dead. clusters.title: British skiers killed in Alps avalanche named
clusters.neutral_headline: British Skiers Killed In Alps Avalanche Named

items.title: British skiers killed in Alps avalanche named
items.standfirst: Two British skiers who died in an avalanche at a French Alps ski resort last week have been named.
items.content: Two British skiers who died in an avalanche at a French Alps ski resort last week have been named.

items.title: Two British skiers killed in French Alps named
items.standfirst: Stuart Leslie, 46, and Shaun Overy, 51, died while skiing off-piste in Val d’Isère amid red avalanche alertTwo British skiers who died in an avalanche in the French Alps have been named as Stuart Leslie and Shaun Overy.The pair were part of a group of five people, accompanied by an instructor, skiing off-piste in Val d’Isère in south-east France on Friday when they were swept away by falling snow. Continue reading...

items.title: Bobsledder Elana Meyers Taylor, 41, wins gold in 5th Olympic appearance
items.standfirst: Elana Meyers Taylor has won her first Olympic gold in women's monobob, and she made history as the oldest American woman to do it at the Winter Games.
items.content: Elana Meyers Taylor has won her first Olympic gold in women's monobob, and she made history as the oldest American woman to do it at the Winter Games.

items.title: Olympic wins for Team USA in women's bobsledding and hockey
items.standfirst: Team USA won its 18th and 19th medals at the Olympics, including the gold for 41-year-old bobsledder Elana Meyers Taylor, who is now the oldest American woman to ever win gold at the Winter Games. Seth Doane has more.
items.content: Team USA won its 18th and 19th medals at the Olympics, including the gold for 41-year-old bobsledder Elana Meyers Taylor, who is now the oldest American woman to ever win gold at the Winter Games. Seth Doane has more.

items.title: Two U.S. moms in their 40s rocketed to gold and bronze in Olympic bobsled showdown
items.standfirst: American sliders Elana Meyers Taylor, 41, and Kaillie Humphreys, 40, secure gold and bronze medals. Meyers-Taylor built on her record as the Black athlete with the most Winter Olympics medals.
items.content: American sliders Elana Meyers Taylor, 41, and Kaillie Humphreys, 40, secure gold and bronze medals. Meyers-Taylor built on her record as the Black athlete with the most Winter Olympics medals.(Image credit: Aijaz Rahi)

clusters.title: "This is not a political game": France faces reckoning after killing of 23 year old
clusters.neutral_headline: France Faces Reckoning After Killing Of 23 Year Old

items.title: "This is not a political game": France faces reckoning after killing of 23 year old
items.standfirst: The fatal beating of a 23-year-old man in Lyon has shocked France and ignited a fierce political row. The victim, identified only as Quentin, died in hospital after being attacked on 12 February on the sidelines of clashes near a political event at Sciences Po Lyon attended by a left-wing politician. Prosecutors say he was assaulted during confrontations between rival activists and later succumbed to a traumatic brain injury, prompting a murder inquiry by French police.
items.content: The fatal beating of a 23-year-old man in Lyon has shocked France and ignited a fierce political row. The victim, identified only as Quentin, died in hospital after being attacked on 12 February on the sidelines of clashes near a political event at Sciences Po Lyon attended by a left-wing politician. Prosecutors say he was assaulted during confrontations between rival activists and later succumbed to a traumatic brain injury, prompting a murder inquiry by French police.

items.title: France opens murder probe as killing of far-right activist stokes tensions
items.standfirst: French authorities have opened a murder probe into the death of a far-right activist last week, a public prosecutor said Monday, in a killing the government has blamed partly on the hard left. Quentin Deranque, 23, died after sustaining a severe brain injury when he was attacked Thursday by "at least six" people on the sidelines of a far-right protest against a left-wing politician speaking at a university in Lyon. FRANCE 24's Carys Garland reports.
items.content: French authorities have opened a murder probe into the death of a far-right activist last week, a public prosecutor said Monday, in a killing the government has blamed partly on the hard left. Quentin Deranque, 23, died after sustaining a severe brain injury when he was attacked Thursday by "at least six" people on the sidelines of a far-right protest against a left-wing politician speaking at a university in Lyon. FRANCE 24's Carys Garland reports.

items.title: French police launch murder inquiry after far-right activist’s death in Lyon
items.standfirst: Quentin Deranque, 23, who was on sidelines of a protest, died from a brain injury after attack that has fuelled political tensionsFrench police have launched a murder inquiry after a far-right activist died in hospital having been beaten up in an attack that has fuelled political tensions in France.Quentin Deranque, a 23-year-old mathematics student, died from a severe brain injury at the weekend. The Lyon prosecutor, Thierry Dran, said Deranque was assaulted by at least six masked individuals. Police were working to identify suspects and no arrests had been made, Dran said. Continue reading...
items.content: Quentin Deranque, 23, who was on sidelines of a protest, died from a brain injury after attack that has fuelled political tensionsFrench police have launched a murder inquiry after a far-right activist died in hospital having been beaten up in an attack that has fuelled political tensions in France.Quentin Deranque, a 23-year-old mathematics student, died from a severe brain injury at the weekend. The Lyon prosecutor, Thierry Dran, said Deranque was assaulted by at least six masked individuals. Police were working to identify suspects and no arrests had been made, Dran said. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Quentin Deranque killed in Lyon attack
Fatal beating sparks political row
Murder inquiry launched by French police
Attack occurred near political event
Deranque died from traumatic brain injury

clusters.title: Ukraine ex-energy minister named suspect in laundering probe
clusters.neutral_headline: Ukraine Ex Energy Minister Named Suspect

items.title: Ukraine ex-energy minister named suspect in laundering probe
items.standfirst: Ukraine's former energy minister German Galushchenko has been formally named as a suspect in a high-profile money laundering probe, investigators said Monday. The announcement comes one day after Galushchenko was detained by law enforcement attempting to leave Ukraine, and is the latest development in a corruption scandal in the energy sector that rocked the government last year. FRANCE 24's Emerald Maxwell reports.
items.content: Ukraine's former energy minister German Galushchenko has been formally named as a suspect in a high-profile money laundering probe, investigators said Monday. The announcement comes one day after Galushchenko was detained by law enforcement attempting to leave Ukraine, and is the latest development in a corruption scandal in the energy sector that rocked the government last year. FRANCE 24's Emerald Maxwell reports.

items.title: Ukraine's ex-energy minister detained while attempting to leave country
items.standfirst: His detention comes as he faces legal proceedings after being dismissed in a corruption scandal.
items.content: His detention comes as he faces legal proceedings after being dismissed in a corruption scandal.

ai_summary: German Galushchenko named suspect in probe
Galushchenko detained while leaving Ukraine
Corruption scandal rocks Ukrainian government
Investigators announce latest development
Galushchenko faces legal proceedings

clusters.title: US forces board sanctioned oil tanker
clusters.neutral_headline: US Forces Board Sanctioned Oil Tanker

items.title: US forces board sanctioned oil tanker
items.standfirst: US forces have boarded another sanctioned oil tanker in the Indian Ocean after tracking it from the Caribbean as part of efforts to target illicit oil tankers linked to Venezuela.
items.content: US forces have boarded another sanctioned oil tanker in the Indian Ocean after tracking it from the Caribbean as part of efforts to target illicit oil tankers linked to Venezuela.

items.title: US boards second oil tanker in Indian Ocean after it fled Venezuelan raid
items.standfirst: Pentagon tracked sanctioned Veronica III from Caribbean Sea after it left Venezuela on day Maduro was capturedUS military forces boarded another sanctioned tanker in the Indian Ocean after tracking the vessel from the Caribbean Sea in an effort to target illicit oil connected to Venezuela, the Pentagon said on Sunday.Venezuela had faced US sanctions on its oil for several years, relying on a shadow fleet of falsely flagged tankers to smuggle crude into global supply chains. Donald Trump ordered a quarantine of sanctioned tankers in December to pressure the president, Nicolás Maduro, before Maduro was apprehended in January during a US military operation. Continue reading...
items.content: Pentagon tracked sanctioned Veronica III from Caribbean Sea after it left Venezuela on day Maduro was capturedUS military forces boarded another sanctioned tanker in the Indian Ocean after tracking the vessel from the Caribbean Sea in an effort to target illicit oil connected to Venezuela, the Pentagon said on Sunday.Venezuela had faced US sanctions on its oil for several years, relying on a shadow fleet of falsely flagged tankers to smuggle crude into global supply chains. Donald Trump ordered a quarantine of sanctioned tankers in December to pressure the president, Nicolás Maduro, before Maduro was apprehended in January during a US military operation. Continue reading...

ai_summary: US forces board oil tanker in Indian Ocean
Tanker tracked from Caribbean Sea
Pentagon targets illicit oil tankers
Venezuela faces US sanctions on oil
US military operation targets sanctioned tanker
